*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=6c6b3968b605 ***

api: Update readme.

R=golang-dev, bradfitz, dave
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/7303065

Committer: Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org>

LGTM

On Mon, Feb 11, 2013 at 12:12 AM, <r.eklind.87@gmail.com> wrote:

> Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, bradfitz@golang.org, dave@cheney.net
> (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),
>
> Please take another look.
>
>
> https://codereview.appspot.**com/7303065/<https://codereview.appspot.com/7303065/>
>

On 2013/02/11 05:51:04, dfc wrote:
> > Or let's just delete the second sentence and let the file speak for itself.
> 
> SGTM. We don't want to have another change for a possible third exception.

Is it possible to reopen a CL? If so, how?

Why?
On Feb 9, 2013 7:15 PM, <r.eklind.87@gmail.com> wrote:

> Reviewers: golang-dev_googlegroups.com,
>
> Message:
> Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,
>
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://code.google.com/p/go
>
>
> Description:
> api: Update readme to match content of except.txt.
>
> Please review this at https://codereview.appspot.**com/7303065/<https://codereview.appspot.com/7303065/>
>
> Affected files:
>   M api/README
>
>
> Index: api/README
> ==============================**==============================**=======
> --- a/api/README
> +++ b/api/README
> @@ -5,10 +5,9 @@
>  go1.txt (and similarly named files) are frozen once a version has been
>  shipped. Each file adds new lines but does not remove any.
>
> -except.txt lists features that may disappear without breaking
> -true compatibility. The only package there is text/template/parse.
> +except.txt lists features that may disappear without breaking true
> +compatibility. The only packages there are net and text/template/parse.
>
>  next.txt is the only file intended to be mutated. It's a list of
>  features that may be added to the next version. It only affects
>  warning output from the go api tool.
> -
>
>
> --
>
> ---You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google
> Groups "golang-dev" group.
> To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an
> email to golang-dev+unsubscribe@**googlegroups.com<golang-dev%2Bunsubscribe@googlegroups.com>
> .
> For more options, visit https://groups.google.com/**groups/opt_out<https://groups.google.com/groups/opt_out>
> .
>
>
>

> Or let's just delete the second sentence and let the file speak for itself.

SGTM. We don't want to have another change for a possible third exception.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, bradfitz@golang.org, dave@cheney.net (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

On 2013/02/10 06:55:25, bradfitz wrote:
> Why?

Since the text in the README refers to an older version of except.txt. Perhaps it ain't worth the time to keep the README up to date. I'll close this CL.

On Sun, Feb 10, 2013 at 4:34 AM, <r.eklind.87@gmail.com> wrote:

> On 2013/02/10 06:55:25, bradfitz wrote:
>
>> Why?
>>
>
> Since the text in the README refers to an older version of except.txt.
> Perhaps it ain't worth the time to keep the README up to date. I'll
> close this CL.
>

Or let's just delete the second sentence and let the file speak for itself.

Go to https://codereview.appspot.com/7303065/ and un-check "closed" ?
